basics.name: Maame Lankar De Veer
basics.label: Junior Software Developer
basics.summary: Software developer skilled in C, C#, and Rust, with a passion for innovation, continuous learning, and creating impactful solutions. Dedicated to delivering high-quality work and embracing new technologies. Always seeking opportunities to further develop my skills in a professional setting.

work.name: Zedulo
work.summary: Junior VLSI Engineer focused on RTL design, verification, and FPGA prototyping. Experienced in implementing and testing digital logic circuits with Verilog HDL, open-source IPs, and industry-standard simulation tools. Building strong expertise in hardware-software interaction, computer architecture, and system-level design.
responsibilities: Designing and simulating digital logic circuits in VerilogHDL.
Design Verification and Testing with Verilator, icarus verilog and FPGA boards
Reviewing hardware specifications and implementing modules for verification and testing.
Documenting design processes and maintaining version-controlled codebases.
achievements: Implemented a simple I2C Slave Module and got it running in simulation and on an FPGA board communicating with the computer through MCP221A.
Worked with the OpenTitan opensource pusle width modulation (PWM) IP and got it running in simulation and on in house FPGA boards.

work.name: National Communications Authority
work.summary: Assisting in the development and maintenance of software applications using Python and Django. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure quality and timely delivery of software solutions.
highlights: Contributed to a major project that streamlined internal workflows, improving efficiency by 30%
responsibilities: Developed and maintained backend services using Python and Django.
Worked closely with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Participated in daily stand-ups and bi-weekly sprint planning meetings to ensure alignment with project goals.
achievements: Successfully implemented a feature that enhanced user authentication, improving security measures.

work.name: Valley View University
work.summary: Assisted in developing client websites and applications. Gained hands-on experience with front-end and back-end technologies.
